intro: Microlicia insignioides var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender microlicia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
